intro: Monotoca aristata, commonly known as the mountain fritillary, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, often at higher elevations. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem, while its flowers are borne in clusters at the ends of the branches. Monotoca aristata is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
